etymologies: mid 18th century: modern Latin (genus name), from Greek iatros ‘physician’ + trophē ‘nourishment’

definitions: any of various plants or shrubs of the genus Jatropha (family Euphorbiaceae), one species of which (Jatropha curcas) produces seeds that are used in the production of biodiesel.
shortDefinitions: any of various plants or shrubs of genus Jatropha produces seeds that can be used in production of biodiesel
